articles.author: Jack Kim, Kaori Kaneko
articles.description: North Korea conducted what appeared to be its longest ever intercontinental ballistic missile test on Thursday as South Korea warned Pyongyang could seek missile technology from Russia in exchange for deploying troops to help with the war in Ukraine.
articles.title: North Korea conducts longest ICBM test amid storm over troop deployment to Russia

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The Kremlin said on Thursday that Ukraine's leadership was clearly nervous about Russian advances along the front line if Kyiv was asking the United States to supply it with long-range Tomahawk missiles.
articles.title: Kremlin says Ukraine must be nervous if it's asking for US Tomahawk missiles

articles.author: David Latona
articles.description: Spain issued another storm warning on Thursday for part of the Valenica region devastated by floods that have killed at least 95 people, as rescuers scoured flooded fields and stranded cars for those still missing.
articles.title: Spanish rescue teams hunt for missing after deadly floods

articles.author: Jack Queen
articles.description: Elon Musk has been ordered to attend a Thursday hearing in a prosecutor's lawsuit to block the billionaire's $1 million-a-day giveaway to registered swing state voters ahead of the U.S. election on Nov. 5.
articles.title: Musk due in court as $1 million voter giveaway faces courtroom test

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russian forces attacked a strategic bridge across the Bilhorod-Dnistrovskyi Estuary in Ukraine's southern Odesa region overnight, launching two ballistic Iskander missiles and eight guided missiles, Kyiv's military said on Thursday.
articles.title: Ukraine's military says Russian forces attacked bridge in Odesa region overnight

articles.author: Ted Hesson
articles.description: Richard Jones is one of the most outspoken sheriffs in America when it comes to illegal immigration and crime, echoing themes pushed by Donald Trump in the 2024 presidential campaign as the Republican tries to win back the White House.
articles.title: Sheriffs push Trump's 'migrant crime' message with scant evidence

articles.author: Daren Butler, Ece Toksabay
articles.description: Growing regional instability and changing political dynamics have prompted the first bid in a decade to end Turkey's 40-year conflict with Kurdish militants, but its chances of success are unclear as Ankara has given no clues on what it may entail.
articles.title: Turkey looks to end Kurdish PKK conflict as regional instability grows

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Vietnam has protested against China's alleged detention of Vietnamese fishermen and fishing vessels in the contested Paracel Islands in the South China Sea, a foreign ministry spokesperson said on Thursday.
articles.title: Vietnam urges China to release detained fishermen in South China Sea

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A French court has reversed a government ban on Israeli firms participating in next week's Euronaval arms show near Paris, the organisers said on Thursday, confirming media reports.
articles.title: French court reverses ban on Israeli firms at Paris arms show, organiser says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A number of civilians were wounded and material damage was caused by an "Israeli aggression" on Qusayr in Homs province, in central Syria, Syrian state media reported on Thursday.
articles.title: 'Israeli aggression' wounds number of civilians in central Syria's Qusayr area, says Syrian state media
